text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/1d634542cf5ebcd1d5d83bd124b3e1d5e7c96c58|patch 8.2.1479: Vim9: error for list index uses wrong line number>
patch 8.2.1479: Vim9: error for list index uses wrong line number

Problem:    Vim9: error for list index uses wrong line number.
Solution:   Set source line number. (closes #6724)  Add a way to assert the
            line number of the error with assert_fails().

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1479: Vim9: error for list index uses wrong line number · vim/vim@1d63454
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1479: Vim9: error for list index uses wrong line number · vim/vim@1d63454
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: error for list index uses wrong line number. Solution: Set source line number. (closes #6724) Add a way to assert the line number of the error with assert_fails().

patch 8.2.1478: Vim9: cannot use "true" for some popup options

Problem:    Vim9: cannot use "true" for some popup options.
Solution:   Add dict_get_bool(). (closes #6725)

patch 8.2.1477: Vim9: error when using bufnr('%')

Problem:    Vim9: error when using bufnr('%').
Solution:   Don't give an error for using a string argument. (closes #6723)

attachments.title: patch 8.2.1477: Vim9: error when using bufnr('%') · vim/vim@f39397e
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: error when using bufnr('%'). Solution: Don't give an error for using a string argument. (closes #6723)

patch 8.2.1476: filetype test fails on MS-Windows

Problem:    Filetype test fails on MS-Windows.
Solution:   Remove "^" from pattern.

patch 8.2.1475: Vim9: can't use v:true for option flags

Problem:    Vim9: can't use v:true for option flags.
Solution:   Add tv_get_bool_chk(). (closes #6725)

patch 8.2.1474: /usr/lib/udef/rules.d not recognized as udevrules

Problem:    /usr/lib/udef/rules.d not recognized as udevrules.
Solution:   Adjust match pattern. (Haochen Tong, closes 36722)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/021bda56710d98c09a6b35610a476ab2dd8c58ad|patch 8.2.1473: items in a list given to :const can still be modified>
patch 8.2.1473: items in a list given to :const can still be modified

Problem:    Items in a list given to :const can still be modified.
Solution:   Work like ":lockvar! name" but don't lock referenced items.
            Make locking a blob work.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1473: items in a list given to :const can still be modified · vim/vim@021bda5
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1473: items in a list given to :const can still be modified · vim/vim@021bda5
attachments.text: Problem: Items in a list given to :const can still be modified. Solution: Work like ":lockvar! name" but don't lock referenced items. Make locking a blob work.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/7b22117c4ecf383b6f35acef041773a83ec28220|patch 8.2.1472: ":argdel" does not work like ":.argdel" as documented>
patch 8.2.1472: ":argdel" does not work like ":.argdel" as documented

Problem:    ":argdel" does not work like ":.argdel" as documented. (Alexey
            Demin)
Solution:   Make ":argdel" work like ":.argdel". (closes #6727)
            Also fix giving the error "0 more files to edit".

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1472: ":argdel" does not work like ":.argdel" as documented · vim/vim@7b22117
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1472: ":argdel" does not work like ":.argdel" as documented · vim/vim@7b22117
attachments.text: Problem: &quot;:argdel&quot; does not work like &quot;:.argdel&quot; as documented. (Alexey Demin) Solution: Make &quot;:argdel&quot; work like &quot;:.argdel&quot;. (closes #6727)...
